Dialogue.NPCText:
A lithe figure bows low, fox mask gleaming in the lantern light.
"Welcome, traveler, to Hinokami’s Lantern Stage. I am Kagemura, Shadow Dancer, mask-bearer and teller of living dreams."

"The spirit fox within me sees many fates—yours flickers with intrigue!
Will you join my next kabuki play, or simply linger for a tale?"

Option.text: I wish to join your play.
Tell me a story, Fox Spirit.
Tell me of your past, Shadow Dancer.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kagemura’s tail flicks behind his kimono (or does it?).
"Tonight’s piece is ‘Moonlit Shadows: The Fall of Minax’—a tale woven of illusion, memory, and truth.
Step lightly! Actors sometimes become the role they play…"

Will you:

Option.text: Play the Hero: Defender against Minax.
Play the Villain: Agent of Minax.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kagemura presses a lacquered fan into your hand.
“You are the Unbroken Blade—champion of Britannia, sworn to oppose Minax. Your first line?”

Choose your stance:

Option.text: ‘I defend these lands with honor and steel!’
‘The shadows cannot touch a just heart!’

Dialogue.NPCText:
Spotlights shift. Kagemura, now draped in shadow, becomes Minax’s specter.
"O brave fool! Did you think courage alone could withstand eternity?
What would you sacrifice to break Minax’s hold?"

Option.text: ‘Nothing! Minax will fall by my sword!’
‘The hearts of my companions—they are my strength.’

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kagemura passes you a crimson sash.
“Become the Hand of Minax, tempter in the night. Speak your opening threat!”

Option.text: ‘These lands shall kneel before the Mistress of Chaos!’

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kagemura, masked anew, stands as the legendary Unbroken Blade.
“So speaks Minax’s servant. But tell me: why betray your kin for shadows?”

Option.text: ‘The world abandoned us—now it will burn.’

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kagemura bows.
“Then watch as illusion becomes truth! Every play is a spell, every ending a new beginning. If you wish to take the stage, return to me after.”

The lanterns dim, and Kagemura’s voice echoes as if from a dream.
“History repeats upon the stage, but only the brave rewrite the script.
In Minax’s fall, what was truly shattered—the Gem, or the souls of mortals?”

Kagemura’s eyes glint behind his fox mask.
“Would you seek to learn the true secret of Minax’s rise?”

Option.text: The past is better left undisturbed.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kagemura’s mask seems to shift and ripple. The air shivers with illusion.
“Minax was once mortal, like us. Her fury grew from heartbreak and betrayal—when the Gem of Immortality shattered, it was not just worlds that were split, but souls. Some say her vengeance is the echo of a forgotten love, others that she is the shadow every heart hides.”

“Tell this to none but the worthy. When the moon is full, find me beneath the Lantern Tree, and perhaps the Fox will grant you a mask of your own.”

[You sense a new quest is available to you.]

Kagemura slips a folded paper fox mask into your palm.
“May your steps be silent, and your purpose true. The play never ends.”

Kagemura spins his fan, voice deepening.
“Long ago, a fox spirit danced with mortals, teaching them joy, trickery, and sorrow. When the shadow of Minax fell, even spirits wept.
Some say the fox now hides among us—granting wisdom to those who walk between worlds. Will you walk the path of illusions, or the path of steel?”

Option.text: Teach me the path of illusions.
I am a warrior at heart.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kagemura’s tails seem to multiply in the lanternlight.
“Very well. Seek what is hidden, trust not all you see, and remember—truth may be found in a mask as well as a mirror.”
[You feel your senses sharpen. (+10 Stealth for 10m)]

“Then carry the fox spirit in your heart—a trickster’s courage, a warrior’s grace.
Let no shadow find you unready.”
[You feel emboldened. (+10 Swordsmanship for 10m)]

Kagemura leans closer, voice dropping to a whisper.
“Some call me actor, others spirit, a few… deceiver. All are true.
My mask is not just for the stage—beneath it, all truths dance. Perhaps you too wear a mask? What do you seek in Hinokami?”
“Every dawn is a stage’s opening. May your steps find rhythm, and your burdens be light. Return when you seek a part to play.”
“Guidance is found in stories, and in silence between words. Listen well—to others and to yourself.”
“Battle is also a performance—be bold, but do not mistake fury for strength. If you survive the war, return for the afterparty.”

Kagemura’s masked head tilts.
“The past is a thread pulled too tightly—it unravels the soul. But perhaps you’ve earned a glimpse.”

“What part of my tale intrigues you?”

Option.text: Your fox mask... are you truly a kitsune?

Dialogue.NPCText:
He chuckles faintly—an echo like falling leaves.
“The mask is both lie and truth. I was born of mortal blood… but my mother danced with foxfire, and the forest spirits knew her name.”

“Sometimes, I dream with more tails than one. Does that make me kitsune? Or simply cursed?”

Do you believe him?

Option.text: Yes. Your aura hums with magic.
Kitsune or not, your stories have spirit.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kagemura lowers his head in theatrical gratitude.
“Then I grant you a truth: I was born under a waning moon, and in my cradle slept a kitsune fang wrapped in silk. I wear it still.”

[You feel a brush of spiritual magic. +10 Karma]

The fox mask glints knowingly.
“And if mystery is all I am—does that not still make me magic?”
“Come. Let us both wear masks and call it truth.”

“Spirit is everything. Even in fiction, there is fire.”
He flicks a fan across his mask, as if warding off deeper emotion.

Kagemura twirls his fan slowly.
“When I was young, my voice was stolen by a demon of silence. I could not speak, only gesture. Kabuki taught me to sing again, without words.”

“The mask became my voice. The dance, my blade.”

Would you like to see a gesture from that time?

Option.text: It must be a painful memory.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kagemura spins, drops to one knee, and raises his fan in absolute silence.
The moment holds a powerful stillness, as if time pauses.

“And thus, the vow of silence became the vow of performance.”
[You feel an odd serenity. +10 Fame]

“Kindness suits you. Not all memories wish to be danced.”
“But know that from that silence came this shadow.”
He taps his mask gently, as if in thanks.

“I was not born in Hinokami. I have wandered from Tokuno to Skara, from the ruins of Magincia to the cliffs of Serpent’s Hold.”

“Wherever a soul wept beneath a painted sky, I danced. But it was here, in these woods, that I heard the fox call my name.”

Will you ask about his journeys?

Option.text: You’ve traveled far. That explains much.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Serpent’s Hold was stone and silence—disciplined, but weary. Their monks feared joy, for joy can be shattered. I performed once within their shrine—no applause, only bowed heads.”
“Yet… that was enough.”
[You feel contemplative. +5 Int for 5m]

He bows slightly at the name.
“Tokuno was breath and blade. My clan practiced the path of smoke—we vanished before swords could draw.”
“But even smoke cannot hide from fate. My clan… was lost when Minax shattered the spirit gate.”
[You feel a heavy sorrow. Karma -10]
